perturbation.original_text: The obligations of Capital Resources pursuant to this Agreement shall terminate upon the completion or termination or abandonment of the  Plan  by  the  Company  or  the  Association  or  upon  termination  of the Subscription  and  Public  Offerings,  or if the  terms  of the  Conversion  are substantially  amended  so as to  materially  and  adversely  change the role of Capital  Resources,  but in no event later than 45 days after the  completion of the Subscription and Public Offerings (the "End Date").  All fees due to Capital Resources  but unpaid will be payable to Capital  Resources in next day funds at the earlier of the Closing Date (as hereinafter defined) or the End Date. In the event the  Subscription  and Public  Offerings are extended beyond the End Date, the Company, the
perturbation.changed_text: The obligations of Capital Resources pursuant to this Agreement shall terminate upon the completion or termination or abandonment of the  Plan  by  the  Company  or  the  Association  or  upon  termination  of the Subscription  and  Public  Offerings,  or if the  terms  of the  Conversion  are substantially  amended  so as to  materially  and  adversely  change the role of Capital  Resources,  but in no event later than 45 days after the  completion of the Subscription and Public Offerings (the "End Date"). All fees due to Capital Resources  but unpaid will be payable to Capital  Resources in next day funds within 90 days after the End Date. In the event the  Subscription  and Public  Offerings are extended beyond the End Date, the Company, the
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction. The original text states that unpaid fees are payable at the earlier of the Closing Date or the End Date + 45 days. The modified text changes the payment term to within 90 days after the End Date, creating uncertainty about the exact deadline for payment and inconsistency with the closing date.

perturbation.original_text: During the period of three years from the date hereof, the Company  will  furnish to Capital  Resources:  (i) a copy of each  report of the Company  furnished  to or filed  with the  Commission  under the 1934 Act or any national  securities  exchange or system on which any class of securities of the Company is listed or quoted (including but not limited to, reports on Form 10-K, 10-Q and 8-K and all proxy  statements  and annual reports to  stockholders),  a copy of each report of the Company mailed to its  stockholders or filed with the Commission or the OTS or any other  supervisory  or regulatory  authority or any national  securities  exchange or system on which any class of securities of the Company is listed or quoted,  each press  release  and  material  news items and additional  public  documents and information with respect to the Company or the Association as Capital Resources may reasonably  request,  and (ii) from time to time, such other publicly available  information  concerning the Company and the Association as Capital Resources may reasonably request.
perturbation.changed_text: During the period of three years from the date hereof, the Company  will  furnish to Capital  Resources:  (i) a copy of each  report of the Company  furnished  to or filed  with the  Commission  under the 1934 Act or any national  securities  exchange or system on which any class of securities of the Company is listed or quoted (including but not limited to, reports on Form 10-K, 10-Q and 8-K and all proxy  statements  and annual reports to  stockholders),  a copy of each report of the Company mailed to its  stockholders or filed with the Commission or the OTS or any other  supervisory  or regulatory  authority or any national  securities  exchange or system on which any class of securities of the Company is listed or quoted,  each press  release  and  material  news items and additional  public  documents and information with respect to the Company or the Association as Capital Resources may reasonably  request,  and (ii) from time to time, such other publicly available  information  concerning the Company and the Association as Capital Resources deems necessary.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Capital Resources may reasonably request additional information, however the changed text does not have that stipulation for requests. This creates an in-text contradiction and ambiguity in the Company's obligations.

perturbation.original_text: At the closing, the Association shall deliver to Capital Resources in next day funds the  commissions,  fees and  expenses due and owing to Capital Resources  as set  forth  in  Sections  2 and 7  hereof  and  the  opinions  and certificates  required hereby and other documents deemed reasonably necessary by Capital  Resources  shall be executed  and  delivered  to effect the sale of the Shares  as  contemplated  hereby  and  pursuant  to the  terms  of the  Offering Prospectus.
perturbation.changed_text: At the closing, the Association shall deliver to Capital Resources in next day funds the  commissions,  fees and  expenses due and owing to Capital Resources  as set  forth  in  Sections  2 and 7  hereof  and  the  opinions  and certificates  required hereby and other documents deemed necessary by the Association shall be executed  and  delivered  to effect the sale of the Shares  as  contemplated  hereby  and  pursuant  to the  terms  of the  Offering Prospectus.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the other documents deemed reasonably necessary by CAPITAL RESOURCES. The modified text states other documents deemed necessary by the ASSOCIATION. This creates an in-text contradiction and ambiguity about other necessary documents.
